intro: Strophanthus erythroleucus, commonly known as the red-leaved strophanthus, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is characterized by its striking red foliage and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed-like species. Its stems are woody and often have a milky sap, and it is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, though it contains toxic compounds that require careful handling.
